timeline.message: Guava is not in Maven's example

timeline.bodyText:
This example somehow does not use "platform".
https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/platforms.html#sub:bom_import. So updating with a valid example.
timeline.author: suztomo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -173,7 +173,15 @@ you are using at least Gradle 4.6. To do this:
 - Add a dependency on the BOM for the library you depend on
 - Remove the version from the dependency declarations of the artifacts in that library
 
-For an example, see [gax-java#690](https://github.com/googleapis/gax-java/pull/690/files).

replies.bodyText:
Is this maybe something that changed from 4.x to 5.x? or 5.x to 6.x?
also "However often BOMs are not only providing versions as recommendations, but also a way to override any other version found in the graph. You can enable this behavior by using the enforcedPlatform keyword, instead of platform, when importing the BOM:"
replies.author: elharo

replies.bodyText:
Gradle documentation has "platform" in BOM section since its 5.0 release.
https://docs.gradle.org/5.0/userguide/managing_transitive_dependencies.html#sec:bom_import
4.6 release note does not have it. https://docs.gradle.org/4.6/release-notes.html#bom-import
Updated the example code snippet to use enforcedPlatform.
replies.author: suztomo

timeline.author: elharo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -173,7 +173,15 @@ you are using at least Gradle 4.6. To do this:
 - Add a dependency on the BOM for the library you depend on
 - Remove the version from the dependency declarations of the artifacts in that library
 
-For an example, see [gax-java#690](https://github.com/googleapis/gax-java/pull/690/files).
+```
+dependencies {
+  api platform('com.google.cloud:libraries-bom:4.1.0')
+  api 'com.google.cloud:google-cloud-storage'
+}
+```
+
+For more details, refer to [Gradle: Importing Maven BOMs](
+https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/platforms.html#sub:bom_import) documentation.

timeline.bodyText: Changed the item order to come 5.x come first. Gradle 5.x or higher is more latest (I expect many use 5.x or higher by now) and does not require special statement in settings.gradle.
timeline.author: suztomo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -166,14 +166,24 @@ problem, you can import a BOM to force consistent versions, as long as
 you are using at least Gradle 4.6. To do this:
 
 - Turn on BOM support:
-  - If you are using Gradle 4.x, add 
-    `enableFeaturePreview('IMPROVED_POM_SUPPORT')` to `settings.gradle`. 
-   
   - If you are using Gradle 5.x or higher, BOM support is on by default.
+  - If you are using Gradle 4.6 or higher, add 
+    `enableFeaturePreview('IMPROVED_POM_SUPPORT')` to `settings.gradle`.
